body_html:
Hey, @fmassa and @mhgump, I am in somewhat similar situation and trying to verify that the spatial orientation is preserved.

So, in my case I am sequence of video frames and thus say size of the tensor is B x S x C x H x W where B denotes batch size and S denotes length of each sequence considered.

So what I want to do is to pass each frame through an encoder (for simplicity let's say just one Conv2d layer). For this I am considering something along this line


a = torch.rand(B, S, C, H, W)
a = torch.view(-1,C,H,W)
encoder = nn.Conv2d(C, C_out, 3, stride=2)
a = encoder(a)
_, C_out, H_out, W_out = a.size()
a = a.view(B, S, C_out, H_out, W_out)

Will it preserve the spatial orientation as in the original a
body_text:
Hey, @fmassa and @mhgump, I am in somewhat similar situation and trying to verify that the spatial orientation is preserved.
So, in my case I am sequence of video frames and thus say size of the tensor is B x S x C x H x W where B denotes batch size and S denotes length of each sequence considered.
So what I want to do is to pass each frame through an encoder (for simplicity let's say just one Conv2d layer). For this I am considering something along this line

a = torch.rand(B, S, C, H, W)
a = torch.view(-1,C,H,W)
encoder = nn.Conv2d(C, C_out, 3, stride=2)
a = encoder(a)
_, C_out, H_out, W_out = a.size()
a = a.view(B, S, C_out, H_out, W_out)

Will it preserve the spatial orientation as in the original a
body:
Hey, @fmassa and @mhgump, I am in somewhat similar situation and trying to verify that the spatial orientation is preserved. 

So, in my case I am sequence of video frames and thus say size of the tensor is ```B x S x C x H x W``` where B denotes batch size and S denotes length of each sequence considered. 

So what I want to do is to pass each frame through an encoder (for simplicity let's say just one ```Conv2d``` layer). For this I am considering something along this line
```

a = torch.rand(B, S, C, H, W)
a = torch.view(-1,C,H,W)
encoder = nn.Conv2d(C, C_out, 3, stride=2)
a = encoder(a)
_, C_out, H_out, W_out = a.size()
a = a.view(B, S, C_out, H_out, W_out)
```

Will it preserve the spatial orientation as in the original ```a```
